content.question:
Researchers conducted a study with 200 participants who had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and a comparison group of 200 patients who had not been diagnosed with schizophrenia. The researchers found that participants who had been diagnosed with schizophrenia had statistically larger ventricles1brain cavities filled with fluid  than the comparison group. Based on this finding, the researchers concluded that enlarged ventricles cause people to develop schizophrenia. 
Which of the following most accurately describes why this conclusion is flawed?

choices.label: The researchers’ sample is not large enough to allow researchers to draw any scientific conclusions.
The researchers’ results indicate no correlation between the variables.
The researchers’ conclusion does not adequately account for the role of GABA in developing schizophrenia.
The researchers’ cause-and-effect conclusion cannot be made because no independent variable is manipulated.

content.answer: The researchers’ cause-and-effect conclusion cannot be made because no independent variable is manipulated.
